ratings.comment: 221 and 222 were my favorite math courses at UW-Madison because of Professong Song. She would take the time to write out proofs to some of the concepts we were going over and though I'm no genius nor a mathematician I appreciated this because some of the proofs were simply beautiful. This brought a level of love to math that is not often seen.
Hard tests, make you work for it. Will not have any clue to do her tests without doing practice exams. Good final curve.

Did not understand what she was teaching and it was difficult to learn any concept. She is also a very picky grader and you must solve things her way or you will lose points on tests.  Pray for a good TA because that is the only way I made it through the quarter

Great professor. Really clear and usually does a very good job preparing for lecture and presenting the material to the class. Although she has an accent it is no trouble at all to understand her. The only real problem is is that she doesn't really talk TO the class as much as other math professors. She mostly just relays information to the board.

This is a really good lecture, especially for your GPA. Easy homework. practice exams are almost exactly like the real tests. Even though she has accent, it's s not hard to understand her. Exams are fairly judged

Professor song is thorough, clear, and well spoken. Her accent is a little thick, but you can understand her. She makes jokes and she is always available to help. Also, her exams are not too difficult. Easily my favorite math professor at UW
Prof. Song is awesome! Super nice!!! And the tests are not that tricky or hard. Strongly RECOMMEND!!!
Very hard to understand! Have only gone to 5 lectures to realize I can learn more from the book... TERRIBLE!!!
absolutely horrible NEVER EVER TAKE THIS CLASS
worst professor I've had at UW I warn everyone about her. 0 help. poor lecturer. super strong accent. pray you get a great TA like me

Professor Song was a decent lecturer. I took calc in high school so the course was all review (thank God!). My TA (Eric Ramos) was fantastic which also helped... Very difficult accent to understand but sometimes it makes her downright adorable!
Super difficult to understand. Lectures were straight from course booklet. TAs were not very helpful at all. Luckily I took Calc in high school, so did not have to ever study for the class.
Calc is calc and that doesn't change. But I truly think that she is one of the better teachers. Very helpful if you go to office hours. But the math project sucks...

She was brutal. Very hard to understand her if you aren't the same nationality as her. You can tell she is very intelligent but she is one of those people who cannot explain things very well. That said, if you took AP Calc in high school this class will be easy and you could do a better job with explaining things than her.
It is the best professor. Very easy course and GPA booster.

Ruifang's lectures are pointless; she gives proofs the entire hour. The textbook is terrible & the homework makes no sense. I would be careful taking this class if you have no calculus experience. That being said, she is adorable & genuine & also gives fair exams and a decent curve. She definitely wants to help her students and not see them fail.
I don't wear my bike helmet on my way to lecture because I want to die before I make it to this class.
Amazing math ability. Clearly explanation. Reasonable evaluation.

Haha,she is not a good professor but if you have already learned AP in high school, dont worry and take her. I got A in every exam and just do the practice before the exam and no need to show up in the lecture, in this semester my lecture attendance  is like 40% and I got A...just work hard and you will be fine!
Easy. I love proofs. The professor is really good at math, and answer all my questions quickly and clearly. In fact, the TA is awful.
I like her because she uses a lot of examples to lead the lecture.

Class is not as difficult as some make it out to be, but I guess it depends quite a bit on the TA you get. Exams are manageable if you are solid on the concepts covered. She also posts practice exams that often look like the actual exam. Textbook isn't all too helpful, and lecture is barely helpful at best.
She doesn't teach you anything. Just goes and writes notes that you could find on your own in the book. Also spends a lot of time doing unnecessary proofs.

She's as bad as it gets. Can't say it any better. I despised her almost as much as I despised my TA for the whole semester. She has a Ph.D from Harvard, is clearly smart, but is a terrible professor. Don't take this class, period.

She's as bad as the other reviews say.  She has an accent and lecture's are monotone and boring, but she gets the job done.  This is for many their first college math class, so it's a shock.  She's very thorough with notes so you won't need to look at the book, but she does do  lots of proofs.  The HW's doable, on the tests, just be very detailed.

Very useless lectures.  I had already taken the class , yet when I attended lecture she confused me and I wish I had not gone.  Tests are difficult and difficult to prepare for because notes are so boring.  useless textbook.
Her tests have the same format as the practice tests she gives us. And there are no trick questions, so pretty straight forward. She gives really good notes, and easy pre-lecture quizzes.

She has really helpful notes with plenty of examples. Her pre-lecture quizzes are easy points (if you remember to do them). The only thing I don't like are the projects. They're simple, but not very useful. I'm pretty sure it's in every math professor's syllabus so she has to assign them.
she is a great teacher and the test is pretty straightforward. Do the Practice test before the test, then you will be fine.

Quite possibly the worst professor I have ever had. Prone to handing out long, tedious assingments, extremely difficult tests, and annoying projects while simultaneously failing to describe any of them.

Can't understand her. Messes up on her own problems. She can't explain stuff to people. She never knows if she answers the question a student answered. Obviously, never a good sign. Her tests are extremely hard. I took calc in highschool and still wouldn't recommend it as a class to take if you took calc. Drop her get a different prof. end of story
You can't understand her and she can only explain things one way.

do not take without having attained confidence/proficiency with high school calc-for those (such as myself) with no background, learning from her is impossible. class was useless and terribly difficult. she offers negligible help, laughed when i expressed my lack of background and has has a terrible accent. i am attentive, yet she taught me nothing

Went to Harvard, and for some reason expects us to have about the same knowledge she does... Wastes your lecture time going over unnecessary proofs. Half the time doesn't understand questions people ask. Exams are hell. Take a different professor. Will only be easy if you took calc before. This should not be an intro calc class.
Hard to understand and lectures right out of book.  Exams WAY harder than hw and quizzes.  My TA was awesome, but this prof didn't help at all!
Terrible, terrible teacher. Lectures were drawn out and hard to follow. She taught backwards, starting with examples and finishing with explanations. Horrible professor. Never take her.

Extremely hard professor. Tests are beyond difficult. She just lectures at the board and half the class sleeps. None of it is relevant, just all proofs. Take someone else!! If you are stuck with her, don't go to lecture and just teach yourself. I learned more in the 8 hours of studying for the final one day than i did all semester in her lecture.
Wait to take this class with a different teacher. Exam material counts for 80% of total grade and does not reflect material learned in class.

Ruifang may be the worst teacher I have ever had in my life. She doesn't teach just does proofs while talking to the board. The so-called 50 min class feels like 3 hours of sitting not learning anything, i would recommend not attending and teaching yourself. Avoid Ruifang at all costs, not sure how she still works for the university.

Very, very hard class, made harder by her as a professor. She does a terrible job explaining concepts, and the way she simply speaks to the chalkboard is very frustrating. If you can, take someone else. The exams are incredibly hard, and the weekly quizzes her sections have to take will try to trick you in the harshest way possible. Bad instructor.

Her tests are ridiculous and she  doesn't explain concepts at all.  I'm sure she's a nice person but she is an awful professor.  Make sure you do the homework and go to your discussions if you want a relatively good grade.
She's not easy.  Studied for a week before both midterms and only got B's on both.  Lectures are useless, so it really all matters on what TA you have.  If you have a good one, you'll be ok.

You don't really have to attend lecture. She basically just writes notes from the book and does practice problems that you could do on your own time. Tests are very hard. It is a difficult class and she doesn't really spark interest at all. You just have to get through it.
She is nice and willing to answer questions, but her lecture is really boring. About the exam, I think if one can prepare for the exam according to her guidelines, the exam will not be hard.

Not a good professor at all. Her exams are extremely difficult compared to homework and examples gone over in class. I studied very hard for the second exam and could not even finish with the short amount of time allotted. I recommend someone else.
I did not learn anything about calculus in this class. The stuff taught in class is a proof or example that is not at all relevant to what is on any of the tests. Way harder than it needs to be.

Had absolutely no calculus knowledge prior to this class, and it's safe to say I have no calculus knowledge after taking this class. Do not take her unless you already have a solid background knowledge of all the concepts that 221 covers. Impossible to learn from her endless theorems and useless proofs

Her exams are impossible. She says that she will give you the second derivative, but then doesn't. She isn't impossible to understand, but doesn't answer questions. She uses proofs that are unnecessary and that wastes a lot of time. The homework is a breeze compared to the exams. Take someone else.

Teaches by unneccesary proofs and wastes time that way instead of using examples. Things on tests incorporate many things learned. Examples of this are rarely found in the homework. I reccomend taking another professor.

Very hard professor. If I didn't love calculus as much as I do, I would have developed a genuine distaste for the subject based solely on experiencing her teaching it. If you have a choice, take a different professor. This one doesn't answer questions very well.

No need to read textbook. Exams are easy if u understands homework. Questions in homework are based on lecture note. Overall is easy if u have good high school background. Got an A in 1st midterm and did well on quizzes.
Tests were challenging, but if you really knew the subject you'd do well.  Make sure you either took calc in high school or read the text book like the bible, because she teaches by proofs.
I went into her office hours to get help because I didn't understand a topic. She said, "try harder." Obviously, no help whatsoever.

Overall, not good but not bad. Lectures are from the textbook but that isn't necessarily a bad thing. Her definitions use a lot of "math language" so they are okay. TA's will help clarify concepts so it makes it all okay. I got a BC and A on the midterms and thought I failed the final and ended up with an A so I guess the curve at the end is good.

She is a very hard teacher who goes straight from the book. All the examples done in class are the ones in the textbook. Also she doesn't really connect with the class, she just talks to the board. Her accent makes it slightly more difficult. Avoid if possible. She is very boring and pretty hard.
